channel.title: Comments on: Historical Examples Show Government Intervention Only Prolongs Economic Downturns

item.title: By: Mike P. Sinn
item.dc:creator: Mike P. Sinn
item.description: Good point. But it does make intuitive sense that a country that takes resources from the private economy to maintain poorly managed institutions will not be as successful a country which allows its institutions to be exposed to a "survival of the fittest" evolutionary-style economic system.
item.content:encoded: Good point. But it does make intuitive sense that a country that takes resources from the private economy to maintain poorly managed institutions will not be as successful a country which allows its institutions to be exposed to a “survival of the fittest” evolutionary-style economic system.

item.title: By: Anonymous
item.dc:creator: Anonymous
item.description: Yes, but correlation doesn't necessarily mean causation. One must be careful of this logical fallacy, especially in economics.
item.content:encoded: Yes, but correlation doesn’t necessarily mean causation. One must be careful of this logical fallacy, especially in economics.
